headline.main-hed: Fiat Chrysler Vehicles Being Investigated for Ignition Problems

alt-summary-body.p: Fiat Chrysler vehicles are being investigated by the NHTSA for problems similar to those that stirred major recalls at General Motors.

headline.main-hed: Fiat Chrysler vehicles being investigated for ignition problems
Fiat Chrysler Vehicles Being Investigated for Ignition Problems -- Update
Fiat Chrysler Vehicles Face Probe in U.S.

summary-body.p: Fiat Chrysler vehicles are being investigated by the NHTSA for problems similar to those that stirred major recalls at General Motors.

headline.main-hed: Fiat Chrysler Vehicles Being Investigated for Ignition Problems
headline.deck: Problems Are Similar to Those That Stirred Major GM Recalls

article-body.p: U.S. auto-safety regulators are investigating vehicles produced by Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV for ignition-switch problems similar to those that set off a 2.6 million-vehicle recall by General Motors Co. and that have been linked to at least 13 deaths.

National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said Wednesday the ignition key in several Chrysler and Jeep vehicles can be jostled out of the run position, causing a loss of power to the steering and brakes as well as disabling the air bags.

"Chrysler Group is awaiting additional information from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. The company is prepared to cooperate fully with the investigation," the company said in a statement.

link.highlight: GM Officials Ignored Alert on Car Stalling
Gripes About New Cars Tick Higher

article-body.p: One investigation focuses on roughly 700,000, 2008 to 2010 model-year Dodge Grand Caravan, Chrysler Town and Country and Dodge Journey vehicles. The other looks at 525,000 Jeep Commanders from 2006 and 2007, and Jeep Grand Cherokees from 2005 and 2006, the regulator said.
There have been numerous complaints related to vehicles in both investigations but only one record of an accident and no injuries, NHTSA records show.

NHTSA's probes come as the agency earlier this year made an effort to look at suppliers and manufacturers beyond GM that could have similar issues. In the case of the Grand Caravan, Town and Country and Journey, the vehicles already had been recalled, but the agency is looking into the effectiveness of the fix.
